thread.title: Latest tattoo trend sees women get FRECKLES inked on their faces… and it costs £200 a go

author: nkeegan
title: Latest tattoo trend sees women get FRECKLES inked on their faces… and it costs £200 a go
text:
SPOT THE TREND Latest tattoo trend sees women get FRECKLES inked on their faces… and it costs £200 a go 
Women are now paying to have artificial freckles TATTOOED onto their faces By NATALIE KEEGAN Comments GOOD news for those with freckles – your natural look is all the rage at the moment. 
While there may have been times in your life where you weren’t a fan of your freckling, the fact that women are now paying to have artificial freckles TATTOOED onto their faces should reassure you that your natural quirk is seriously sought after. @mmsouthern / Instagram 4 The semi-permanent technique has seen hundreds of women get the freckles they’ve always dreamed of 
Freckle tattooing is a similar process to the popular eyebrow beautifying trend of microblading – which involves having subtle pigments added to areas of the face. 
But whereas microblading adds the appearance of shape and volume, usually to the eyebrows, freckle tattooing adds a temporary scattering of pretty freckles to the face. 
The semi-permanent technique has seen hundreds of women get the freckles they’ve always dreamed of and costs from around £200. 
But the method can also help people who already have natural freckles give them an extra pop. Latest tattoo trend sees women get FRECKLES inked on their faces 
According Montreal cosmetic tattoo artist Gabriella Rainbow, other customers include those who are fans of their summer freckles who want to keep them all year round. @mmsouthern / Instagram The freckles can either bee added to freckle-free faces or those who want to enhance what they already have RELATED STORIES the only way is orange Brit men under 25 more likely to fake tan than women, as celebs like Mark Wright lead trend AND POUT What are lip fillers, how much do they cost and how long do they last? What we know about the celeb beauty trend BRAZEN BEAUTY From chiselled cheeks, to embellished hair: Get Autumn/Winter beauty ready with this season's trends 'Would you pull in this?' Eamonn Holmes tests bizarre new beauty trend by painting blue glitter on his face @rachaelhead_tattoo / Instagram The freckles are tattooed in a similar way to semi-permanent make-up techniques @mmsouthern / Instagram Would you ever try fake freckles? 
She told Elle Canada: “I try to go with the whole policy of less is more. 
“I do a little bit, but [clients] always come back within a few days and are like: ‘I want more freckles!’” 
Fans of the technique have been showing off their new additions on Instagram. 
Once tattooed, the freckles can last up to two years and will fade slowly over time – unless they are topped up and maintained. 
And for freckle-seekers who want a less permanent process, there are other options available. 
One such option is offered by Los Angeles-based company, Faux Freckles - who sell ready-to-wear sheets of fake freckles that apply like a temporary tattoo. 
Would you try faux freckles?
